heliolib.clearsky_modelling package

Submodules

heliolib.clearsky_modelling.location_based_clearsky_irradiance module

class heliolib.clearsky_modelling.location_based_clearsky_irradiance.LocationBasedClearskyIrradiance(latitude, longitude, altitude, timezone, times)[source]

Bases: object

A class for calculating clear sky irradiance parameters at a given location and time.

Parameters

latitude (float):

Latitude of the location in degrees (-90 to 90).

longitude (float):

Longitude of the location in degrees (-180 to 180).

altitude (float):

Altitude of the location in meters above sea level.

timezone (str):

Timezone of the location (e.g., ‘Europe/London’).

times (pandas.DatetimeIndex):

Timezone Aware Datetime index specifying the times for which to calculate the parameters.

Methods

_get_site_location():

Retrieve location details using latitude, longitude, altitude, and timezone.

_get_solar_position():

Calculate solar position parameters based on times.

_get_airmass():

Calculate airmass values based on solar position and times.

_get_linked_turbidity():

Lookup Linked turbidity values based on location and times.

_get_extra_radiation():

Get extra radiation values based on times.

get_clearsky_ghi():

Calculate clear sky global horizontal irradiance (GHI) parameters.

Returns: - pandas.DataFrame: DataFrame containing clear sky GHI parameters for each time.

get_clearsky_poa(surface_tilt, surface_azimuth):

Calculate clear sky plane-of-array (POA) irradiance parameters.

surface_tilt (float): Tilt angle of the surface in degrees. surface_azimuth (float): Azimuth angle of the surface in degrees.

pandas.DataFrame: DataFrame containing clear sky POA parameters for each time.

get_clearsky_ghi()[source]

Calculate clear sky global horizontal irradiance (GHI) parameters.

Returns: - pandas.DataFrame: DataFrame containing clear sky GHI parameters for each time.

get_clearsky_poa(surface_tilt, surface_azimuth)[source]

Calculate clear sky plane-of-array (POA) irradiance parameters.

Parameters

surface_tilt (float): Tilt angle of the surface in degrees. surface_azimuth (float): Azimuth angle of the surface in degrees.

Returns

pandas.DataFrame: DataFrame containing clear sky POA parameters for each time.

heliolib.clearsky_modelling.location_based_single_axis_tracker_clearsky_irradiance module

class heliolib.clearsky_modelling.location_based_single_axis_tracker_clearsky_irradiance.LocationBasedSingleAxisTrackerClearskyIrradiance(location_based_clearsky_irradiance: LocationBasedClearskyIrradiance)[source]

Bases: object

A subclass of Clearsky for calculating clear sky irradiance parameters specifically tailored for a single-axis tracker configuration in both LAT/UTC times.

Inherits from Clearsky to utilize its methods for clear sky calculations.

Parameters

location_based_clearsky_irradiance (class):

LocationBasedClearskyIrradiance

times (pandas.DatetimeIndex):

Datetime index specifying the times for which to calculate the parameters. Works for both LAT and UTC times.

Methods

_get_clearsky_curve_for_tracker(axis_tilt, axis_azimuth, max_angle, backtrack, gcr):

Calculate clear sky curve parameters for a single-axis tracker.

axis_tilt (float):

Tilt angle of the tracker axis in degrees. Range [0, 90]

axis_azimuth (float):

Azimuth angle of the tracker axis in degrees. Range [0, 180]

max_angle (float):

Maximum rotation angle of the tracker in degrees. Range [-90,90]

backtrack (bool):

Boolean indicating whether the tracker has a backtracking feature. [True/False]

gcr (float):

Ground coverage ratio of the tracker. Range [0, 1]

pandas.DataFrame: DataFrame containing tracker data for each time.

get_clearsky_poa_for_tracker(axis_tilt, axis_azimuth, max_angle, backtrack, gcr, poa_model=’haydavies’):

Calculate clear sky plane-of-array (POA) irradiance parameters for a single-axis tracker.

axis_tilt (float):

Tilt angle of the tracker axis in degrees. Range [0, 90]

axis_azimuth (float):

Azimuth angle of the tracker axis in degrees. Range [0, 180]

max_angle (float):

Maximum rotation angle of the tracker in degrees. Range [-90,90]

backtrack (bool):

Boolean indicating whether the tracker has a backtracking feature. [True/False]

gcr (float):

Ground coverage ratio of the tracker. Range [0, 1]

poa_model (str, optional):

POA irradiance model to use (default is ‘haydavies’).

pandas.DataFrame:

DataFrame containing clear sky POA irradiance for the tracker for each time.

get_clearsky_poa_for_tracker(axis_tilt, axis_azimuth, max_angle, backtrack, gcr, poa_model='haydavies')[source]

Calculate clear sky POA irradiance for a single-axis tracker

heliolib.clearsky_modelling.plant_level_multiindex_single_axis_tracker_clearsky_irradiance module

class heliolib.clearsky_modelling.plant_level_multiindex_single_axis_tracker_clearsky_irradiance.MultiindexSingleAxisTrackerClearskyIrradianceGenerator(array_info, location_based_single_axis_clearsky_object)[source]

Bases: object

Generates multi-indexed clearsky irradiance data for a single-axis solar tracker system.

This class calculates and organizes clearsky irradiance data based on various orientations of single-axis solar trackers using input array information and a location-based clearsky model.

Args

array_info (pd.DataFrame): A DataFrame containing information about the solar arrays,

including axis tilt, axis azimuth, and phi angle for each array configuration.

location_based_single_axis_clearsky_object: An object that provides clearsky irradiance data

based on location-specific parameters.

Attributes

array_info (pd.DataFrame): The DataFrame containing information about the solar arrays. location_based_single_axis_clearsky_object: The clearsky irradiance model specific to the location.

Methods

generate_multiindex_tracker_clearsky_irradiance():

Generates multi-indexed clearsky irradiance data for the entire solar plant based on the provided array information.

Raises

ValueError: If array_info contains NaN values for axis tilt, axis azimuth, or phi angle. Exception: Any other exception that occurs during the generation process is logged,

and the original exception is re-raised.

Example usage

generator = MultiindexSingleAxisTrackerClearskyIrradianceGenerator(array_info, clearsky_model) plant_clearsky_irradiance = generator.generate_multiindex_tracker_clearsky_irradiance()

generate_multiindex_tracker_clearsky_irradiance()[source]

Generates multi-indexed clearsky irradiance data for the entire solar plant.

This method orchestrates the generation of clearsky irradiance data for various solar tracker orientations based on the provided array information and location-based clearsky model. The generated data is organized into a multi-indexed DataFrame for further analysis.

Returns:
pd.DataFrame: A multi-indexed DataFrame containing clearsky irradiance data

aligned with input array configurations.

Raises:
Exception: If any exception occurs during the generation process, it is logged,

and the original exception is re-raised.
